property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Pakistanis walking to a meeting near Islamabad

note.text: In general, U.S. service members have found their Pakistani counterparts to be punctual and meetings to be precisely coordinated. Expect meetings with military counterparts to begin on schedule.

However, civilians may have an idea of time that is more relaxed, and meetings can begin or end much later than agreed upon. If a counterpart arrives late, don't call attention to it. Just proceed as if they had been on time. Never leave a meeting before your counterpart has arrived. Doing so may suggest that you do not value your relationship with your counterpart.
